text: I don't live anywhere near this location but the travel was worth it. First time here and ordered my favorite matcha and it is delicious and refreshing. Many and many different flavors to choose from as well.

Very small menu and the older lady that just took my order is Super Rude!!!! You Just lost a customer.  On top of that, was the weird tasting Boba.  Like some kind of medicine-y taste to it.  Would not go back or recommend.
omg icecream for $1.99 !!! i noticed they lowered their price on all drinks today . I love this dessert shop . my favorite place to indulge

Definitely check this place out.

I stopped by here the other day since I was craving boba, having seen it several times on my way to work, which is close by. The interior is sparse and rather cold, actually, but before I could be put off by this the owner behind the counter greeted me and correctly assumed I was on the hunt for boba. He handed me a sample of the mango smoothie they serve - delicious! Tastes like it actually comes from mangoes.

I ordered a milk tea though, and while waiting for my drink, the owner handed me a coupon and one of those stamp cards, and went on to explain the ice cream they serve is handmade. Again, he gave me a sample of banana split and tiramisu flavors. The banana split was divine, and I normally dislike banana flavors alone. 

The milk tea was admittedly nothing special but these guys seem to have enough tasty things and good customer service for me to want to come back, and I will. I hope they will hang through the economy and have a loyal customer base.
Amazing customer service and tasty boba drinks. I stopped here on my way back to Utah to satisfy my boba craving and was very happy. Got the Thai Tea and im lovin it

Great place for Boba, living on the southwest side of town it's very convenient in terms of location. The new owners and staff are wonderful and very personable. Nice place to hang out when you have free time, especially during the summer. Not only do they have an affordable variety of drinks and desserts they have a decent snack menu also. I can't stop bragging about this place, I highly recommend you come here. :)

My friend recommended this place to me while I was staying over with family at Las Vegas and I have to say, they have the most delicious coconut and taro smoothie with boba in the world. Back at my place we don't even have coconut smoothie -__- and the shop looked really cute! And the ice cream looked delicious *O* gotta get some of those next time! And the waitress was really nice because I was taking a longggg time deciding my order. All in all I recommend this place when you want something delicious to drink or you're craving something cold :)

Just want to give another thumbs up for Boba City Cafe.

The menu is diverse (hard to decide what to get, so many options) and appealing. I haven't tried any of the food, but have not been disappointed with the numerous drinks and gelato I've had here. The boba balls have been consistently really good - soft and chewy, not too soft nor too hard. 

It is a bit pricier compared to some of the boba places in Chinatown, but I think it's worth it considering the great service and quality of the drinks/gelato. They have a stamp card that you can either receive, or just ask for. Maybe it's the time of the day that I've been popping in at, but I've usually found the place empty or only 1 other patron. Great for me since it means I can receive my order fast.

Another great feature: I've received numerous small samples of their fruit "snow" drinks, which were highly welcomed! I definitely try to make a stop if I'm in the area...I only wish it were closer to my home.

The lady was unhelpful and seemed annoyed by all my questions I was asking her. This place is expensive with a large smoothie being over 6 bucks. I ordered the mango slushi w/ boba. My slushi was watery and felt like there was hardly any boba in it. Go to Easy Life.

I absolutely love boba city cafe!  Their boba teas come with the cool lids and thick straws that everybody loves.  I had the Thai tea with boba and it was delish! I also ordered the combination sandwich and loved the flavors of the meat and sauce.  The sandwich could have a little more filling (filling to bread ratio is more bread than meat or veggies) tho, but honestly all the flavors and spices made up for that.  I definitely will recommend to my friends that are in the area looking for a quick snack or even lunch.  Keep up the great work boba city!
One of the best milk tea places ive been to and i travel for good food!

Guy server was very friendly, boba abit on the tough side, the Thai tea boba is very good, he told me it's real Thai tea imported from Thailand not like the extremely sweet ones they served elsewhere.

Stopped in after going to the foot spa. We saw they also had smoothies. Well they advertise they have smoothies. I asked for a smoothie and got a cip of chocolate and vanilla ice cream. I honestly could not understand her response to why. 
The ice cream was not good. It tasted more like ice milk. 
Will not be back. 
,

I hate to give a bad review, but after a second bad visit, I've got to.

First, I'll say the boba milk tea was good, other than a little too much ice. Had it twice. This is why I gave Boba City Cafe 2 stars instead of 1. The only problem I had with the boba was the price. It was expensive to begin with, and Boba City Cafe charges extra if you want boba in your boba tea. Not extra boba, ANY boba. What? I've been to plenty boba places and none charge for this.

While the tea was fine, the service was terrible. I purchased one of the Groupon deals for this place (the one Groupon came with multiple vouchers for separate visits). The first time, the man working the counter said I couldn't use it because his boss wasn't there and only the boss is authorized to redeem Groupons, despite the fact that there is no disclaimer on the Groupon itself. After arguing with him, he redeemed it, though I believe he charged me too much over the value of the voucher.

I went back 2 days later to redeem another voucher and the same guy said, "oh, those are expired." The voucher clearly shows they aren't, which I pointed out. Then he said, again, "My boss isn't here and I can't redeem those." After another, more-drawn out fight, he did redeem the voucher. With the nickle-and-diming with the boba and the reluctance to redeem deals they sold, I suspect this place is fishy,

Maybe this place is good if you're not using a Groupon, though I think most people would be irritated to see an extra charge on top of their $4 boba tea so that the tea would have boba in it. Too expensive, rude/ and poor service, cafe doesn't sell the vast majority of items on its menu. I won't be returning.

I go into Boba City cafe for a quick bite while i run my errands, i order a large avocado smoothie with boba and a vietnamese chicken sandwich. First off the pricing posted on the wall for this smoothie did not reflect the actual price which was taped to the 1 register. i end up psying $6 or $7 for a large smoothie which was waaaayy overpriced. It tasted like the avocados that had been used were over ripe. In a word putrid!! When i go and pay I had some bill and like 70 cents change which the cashier helped herself to as a tip instead of giving it me. This should have been the first inclination of trouble. The sandwich was ok, fresh. I take my food and siy in my car, then decide to go back in to ask if I could get another drink instead. The cashier then said I had to pay for another. Obviously if I'm asking for a new drink this must be disgusting. Overall the service was very poor and unprofessional and it seems to me that they are  trying to make up for the lack of customers by helping themselves to your change one customer at at a time. My advice is to got to Chinatown for better prices, tastier food, and faster service.

DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!!!

$3.50 for 24 oz tea with boba. 
This place was closed but recently reopened under new management.

Really? People can't really be this bad at working and getting the basics right. Order: coke soda, kiwi smoothie with strawberry boba, egg rolls (veggie) and the roast beef sandwich with JUST mayo and cheese.  

MISTAKE #1: they made a kiwi slushie not smoothie with regular (black) boba instead of with strawberry boba. Totally wrong. 
MISTAKE #2: roast beef sandwich had all of the toppings instead as regulated with just cheese n mayo. 
MISTAKE #3: not a mistake per-say but it took 15 minutes just to get us our coke. That should of been the first thing out. 

PROS: eggs rolls were bomb. My friend called and they were willing to fix order, so we drove back to get the correct order.  They were nice about it and apologized.

I ordered the expresso mocha and it's really good the coffee is strong but it doesn't over power the flavor of the other ingredients. The place is clean. The owners are very nice, I will definitely come be coming back!

Groupon sent us here and the three times we've visited, the place was empty.. way too quiet. Boba drinks were waaaaay too sweet & without the Groupon, a little pricey. I think the only good thing is their Cookies & Cream. 

Also, to Boba City Cafe, if you're not selling Deli Manjoo anymore, remove the signs, remove the multiple product placements & get rid of the machine so you won't disappoint people walking in wanting to buy Deli Manjoo. I'm just saying.

OMG!!!  I've been here many times more than I have counted!!  And I haven't had anything I didn't like.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE their boba!!!  I grew up in California and haven't had any boba this fresh!!  The husband and wife team is always there to make your drinks themselves.  Very nice touch of customer service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Drinks was ok... Veggie egg roll was kinda good... Fries I didn't like it need more seasoning and it was hard...  Won't be coming back...
This use to be my favorite boba spot, until I kept getting drinks with funky tasting boba. Honestly, the last 2 times I went the boba tasted so disgusting I couldn't even drink the milk tea.

Boba milk tea was not that great. We ordered a coconut and taro milk tea and both did not taste that great. Plus they were served a lot warmer than we'd liked, especially because it was hot (ask them to put more ice). The slushee in the other hand was pretty good and cold. The prices are great. $4 for a large.
I strongly recommend this place. The egg rolls are to die for. The lichee boba slush is amazing.

Came back two years later and with no customers in there the lady still took 5 mins to greet us. Then we were greeted by "what? What you looking for?" Lmao how is this place still in business. We walked right out. What a P.O.S

I was pretty disappointed.  It's bizarre to name your store BOBA CITY CAFE but have an extra .50 charge to have the boba IN the drinks. The drinks without the boba are already pricey and it's surprising that they wouldn't note the extra charge on their menu to have the boba in. Total of $4 for a medium size boba drink with boba is a bit too much. Ugh. On a brighter note, drinks were perfect, boba was the right texture...not too hard nor too soft. BUT, there are other boba stores in the valley that offers the same quality drinks with reasonable prices.
I'm a fan of coconut boba drinks.  You gotta try this place if you want a good boba drink. Worth my drive from Aliante.

Taro snow boba, fairly solid. Boba was a bit overcooked but flavor of the taro was prominent instead of watered-down, as it has been elsewhere. Drink sizes, medium and large, are generous and pricing is about average: medium is just under $5.

Store itself has plenty of retro seating and offers a food menu of sandwiches and various fried snacks as well as drinks- iced coffee drinks and free wifi included.

Signage posted for a free size upgrade when posting a review on Yelp- not sure if this is really kosher, should probably be a check-in deal instead of soliciting reviews but whatever. Would come back when in the area, but I'm usually not in this neck of the woods.

Side note: walked up to the counter and a previous customer's wallet and sunglasses were left there. Found it odd that the cashier didn't seem to notice, but it was returned to it's owner who was seated nearby.
Ain't no city like a boba city. My favorite local boba spot. From hot and cold drinks, with slushie or smoothie drinks. to snacks, sandwich's,&wraps. Love this place

Had a evening craving for boba. Initially went to Chef Zen, but they were closed. Decided to try this place since it is close to the house. Excellent customer service. Ordered the lychee smoothie with boba and it definitely hits the spot. I will be back.

Is it me or every boba tea place in town has a minimum charge on the card?

$5 minimum for this place. Boba was alright. Wasn't that much selection, it's either milk tea or green tea. Either or, you're not bombarded with a lot of choices.

Food was decent but shoot, $4 for 5 pieces of squid balls! Just too expensive. The drinks were priced decently. The plates? Oh no, you're better off making your own lunch/dinner at home.
Ive been wanting to come back here because they have the best boba. For the past week I had 3 from different places but I have to have this one. This hits the spot.

Felt like trying another Boba place because got the Boba itch and it close too home. I never been too Boba City Cafe so really had no expectations. Just looking forward too more Boba. Talk about tiny place not many seats inside or out but they do offer tiny patio area. It not just Boba they serve also regular food mostly asian noodle or rice dishes. But strictly here for the Boba. Unfortunately since my last Boba at No 1 Boba Tea set high standard but still came here with open mind. I ended up getting the strawberry/banana. Solid not overkill on the sweet tooth but still could taste both fruits in it. I love my tapioca balls and felt like not enough. If not endless amount of tapioca balls till the last sip then just not Bobalicous for me. The tapioca balls are good just wish there was more (you can get extra scoop for 50cent) now I know order extra scoop. The service was good had no problems ordering and the guy even gave me sample of the mango never ask for with my Boba. It seems not too busy of place or least when I went in later in the evening. So always plus. Not as many choices of Boba but sometimes less is better in life. I think in Boba case more might be better. Still have too say No 1 Boba Tea is my favorite but if need of my Boba not shy away from coming back since so close too home.

I hate to start with the negative, but if this review was just for the boba it would have likely been two stars. I got the jasmine milk tea which is a staple for me and it might have been the worst version I have ever tried. The boba balls were fine for me but it tasted like sugar water. I didn't even finish it. Also the location itself seemed dangerous. People drive crazy fast through the parking lot and the whole complex seems rather old. When you walk into the store it feels like a totally different place because the outside and inside are polar opposites. 

BUT THERE WAS A SAVING GRACE! 

The spam masubi they make here is ideal for my particular taste. I wanted to order just one but they only come in a three pack, so I just bought three and thought I would take some home to my boyfriend. Wrong! They were so good I ended up eating all three in the car on the way home entirely by accident. I have a very little, baby sweet tooth. When I get the spam masubis at Aloha Kitchen they are drenched in sweet sauce and I usually don't even finish them. So, I resort to making my own at home because a friend I had in high school taught me how she preferred it. These remind me so much of my own version. They are spicy, not spicy as in burn your mouth but spicy as in you can taste the spices on the spam. So flavorful and much less sweet than any other version I have purchased at a store. I will be back just for that!

This place is amazing the avocado smoothies are the best around town, the boba is made fresh with every order, so it's still a little warm when you drink it which I LOVE.  The customer service is great, I wish I knew about this place sooner I have been here 5 times already

This place is really good! The boba and delimanjoo was the best I ever had. I've lived in Vegas my entire life, and I've been to a bunch of boba places. This place is one of the best in my list.
I definitely recommend! :)

Love this place! Been here twice and will keep going. Had matcha latte with boba and chicken sandwich and fried chicken for my sister. Lets just say my taste buds were very happy. Pretty sure I'm addicted ro their matcha latte/milktea. The same girl served me both times and she was very attentive, very friendly, helpful and a fast server. Overall everything was excellent!

Best boba tea place EVER!!!! The chai tea and chicken wings are amazing. The girl at the front desk is very knowledgeable when it comes to the tea and is also super friendly. Anyone know if they cater? I've got a lot of friends that like boba a lot and they are that good!!
My first time here. Grabbed 2 bobba drinks. It was ok but super expensive. It was over $11 for just 2 drinks. Yikes! Decor is kind of outdated and grungy hence doesn't explain the high prices.
One if the best boba that I ever had. The coffee itself was so good!! Very smooth and I just had to go back before leaving Vegas!!

Went there yesterday for a quick peek on the new boba store. It's interior is simple, modernistic, and clean which is always a plus for me. Their menu have rice combo that is to die for, varieties of ice cream flavor, and of course, boba drinks. :)

I spoke with the boss and he told me everything on the menu are high quality and self selected by him (and his wife). Obviously he wants everything on the menu to surpass the rest of the other competitive stores out there. So skimming through the boba list, I decided to try the taro smoothie and several different types of ice cream. And I've got to say, he's right. Not only was the smoothie taste just right but you can really tell that it's not artificial taro flavor (I know because I drank so many taro smoothies that I know which one taste good and which is bad :P). The same with their ice cream! Omgg, I can really find myself to be a regular when summer arrives. Their creamy dessert makes me feel like a giddy child when I savor their delicious creation and I'm not even a fan of ice cream! Mmm I can feel my day become all better already just by thinking of it. :)

So overall, from my personal experience, I'll say you'll get your money worth when you come Boba City.

The new owners of this cafe are very nice and they made it much better than it was. It is a small, pleasant place. The ambiance is clean and relaxing. Their dishes are tasty, prices aren't too high. Staff is nice and friendly, but the service is a little bit slow. I had to wait to place my order for about ten minutes. That was not a big deal for me,  I wasn't in a hurry, but if you don't have enough time you'll be nervous for sure.
Overall, this is a good place to hang out if you are not busy and especially when it's too hot outside. You can have reasonably priced variety of drinks and desserts here. Will come back again.

If you're in the mood for a honeydew boba tea this is the place for you. It's spectacularly rich and decadent as a milk tea or a slush. I've noticed this is the the best quality boba in the area. Sometimes when I get it elsewhere the drink can taste watered down. I've never had that problem here. Chai and Thai boba are also outstanding, but honeydew is my favorite so far. Steer clear of matcha. I'm not sure who would like that, but that's just weird. I guess it's a thing though; just not mine.  

The staff is super friendly and always double checks to make sure everything is just perfect before you leave. If not (like the time I ordered matcha by accident) they will make sure it gets rectified. It was completely my fault, but they gave me a different drink for free.

Heads up- there's a 50 cent charge each time you use your credit card. Bring cash.

Stopped in this place just before it closed after getting a massage next door. Got the blended chai with boba, and it was great, but the boba wasn't very sweet at all. I would go back for the gelato alone! We got to try the pumpkin gelato, and it was like frozen pumpkin pie, so good!

@ Norm- Glad you Got to try BCC....always happy to peep out the BOMB spots in Vegas!

On the way home from work I stopped in for my boba fix, but this time, I couldn't decide....Taro snow with boba? or Avocado snow with boba?

Here's what I decided-Large(as always) Avocado snow with boba AND
a scoop of Taro Gelato as I wait for my order.

LOVED every bite of it! not too sweet, and there's bits of taro in every bite, (I renamed it "Poi Gelato":)

This time she sent me off with a little taste of their mango smoothie and it was awesome too.

Can't wait for the day Theres a "Big Gulp" sized cup so I won't run out
during the drive home!!!....ALOHA!!!
I had the mocha frappe with regular boba. It was pretty tasty. Service was a little slow because there was only 1 person working at the time. This was pretty average boba but I would return.

Place is a neat local place. The boba isnt that great though, but if I were to crave boba immensely I'd go here seeing its so close. Seems like its just powder or something. Their non boba tea items are great though like their sandwiches or coffee choices. Try the coconut waffle with chocolate ice cream, shits bomb as fuck. I dont even like coconut, but seriously I cant get enough of that shit, dude. Their sandwich was good, but I can only claim that for the chicken one.

The employees there are really nice. I usually go there just to eat the coconut waffle, but end up getting invested in a conversation with the workers (which is a good thing since I go everywhere alone and company is nice). I wish I had more money to tip more often there ;-;. Service does take some time, but thats expected with 2 people working there while trying to serve multiple people and the waffle iron having to heat up. Im extremely patient and the wait is worth it as long as youre not getting boba since thats only okay.

Environment is clean and relaxing. Id play my 3DS in there for hours if it werent so obnoxious. They have those chairs in there thats shaped as a sphere that looks uncomfortable, but its a neat and comfy chair to wind down in. The place is small, so it can get loud even with a few people in there. Although, I don't really think thats a problem for most people its just something to point out.

Pros: good dishes (Ive only had their coconut waffles and chicken sandwich), good price, decent variety of things for a cafe, fun and outgoing employees.

Cons: some people may dislike the wait (dont be such impatient bitches, bitches. In fairness it's not a place to go to if youre in a rush, but that's common sense.),  and boba is only okay (only a problem since "Boba" is in the cafes name.)

This place should be more out there and I think it deserves a bit more success.

Edit: I forgot to mention, but this place has a lot more than boba. They have stuff like poppong strawberry balls, which is always nice, and jelly.

I had never had the opportunity to experience boba before - so I was excited and a bit nervous at the same time. The man behind the counter was unbelievably helpful, providing us with samples before we actually settled on our flavor. They allow you to add boba to anything - which is fantastic. The boba was fresh and flavorful. The tazo is to die for, I also highly recommend the green tea and peanut butter oreo!

This is our favorite Boba place. If you like Boba, it is fresh. If you don't, any drink can be done without Boba. This amazing store is owned and operated by the nicest family. We are always greeted with a smile and great service. I strongly recommend Boba City Cafe.

I stopped today and finally got my Delimanjoo pastries - a small box of 24 miniature, custard filled delights.  I also got a chai milk tea with boba.  It was great!  When my wife asked for a taste, she said, :I want one of those."  Oh well, I'll just have to stop again!

The owners here are super friendly.  It's been two months since I was here and he remembered that I wanted the pastries.  I watched as the machine filled the small molds and he removed them with his tongs at the end of the baking.

I'll be back.  This place is great.

Thanks, Nelson!

I am so happy I found a Boba place in Las Vegas.  It is a little far from where I live but it is on the way home from eating dim sum.  It definitely is a perfect ending to a great Brunch! 

1 star = for the variety drinks they have available to make
2 stars = for their frequent buyer club where you get a stamp for each drink you purchase and by the tenth one, then you get your next drink FREE!  Sweet deal!
3 stars = for the great customer service.  They are super nice there and even offer samples!
4 stars = for the creme cakes.....OMG..i discovered them here and they make them fresh.  SO GOOD!  I can eat like 100 of them. 

Lacks the 5th star because they don't make their drinks consistently the same.  I believe the lady that works there makes them the best because she takes her time.  Overall, everything is yummy!  I'll be back over and over!

I finally tried the egg rolls today, and feel like I can fairly give Boba City Cafe a 5th star! Three pork egg rolls for $2.99. A good deal... and they were damn tasty too! 

We also got some delicious delimanjoo pastries. I have never had these before, they are little custard-filled cakes. Super yummy and super addictive, I know we will be back for more soon.

Jen and Ryan always make me feel like part of the family when I come in to get some boba. They have the best boba drinks I have ever had in my life! They serve a variety of flavors; you'll be guaranteed to find one you'll fall in love with! Like sugar free drinks? Be sure to mention it with your order! Highly recommend this place above all others in the city.

Mom and pop boba shop. Hidden gem!! Next to La Bonita! Super nice people knows about customer service. Not employeed by teenagers, owner work and puts love into it.

Tried everything so far so good!!

Definitely try DeliManjoo!!

Really great customer service! The two clerks that I've dealt with have been polite and very helpful. Really good boba and lots of other things on the menu that are worth the try! I would definitely recommend all fellow boba fanatics to try boba city cafe!!

My latest addiction of Boba Milk Tea lead me to this place. I've been eying this place for awhile now and since it was on my way back to work taking a lil detour I decided to drop on by. The place was empty when I got there and I thought could it be that it's not that good? I asked the lady what was the most popular drink and she mentioned that its the Taro Milk Tea and the Mango....I however decided to just go with the plain old original Boba Milk Tea. I was a bit confused about why the menu had said that there is no dairy used....but the lady working explained to me that they used soy milk. DUH! That's good for us Asians that are lactose intolerant. I came here with a coworker and she ordered the Taro Milk Tea with Boba and these lil cakes called deli manjoo. I've never had deli manjoo before and she brought them out warm to us. I asked her where she bought them and she said we make them here and then points at the molds. They were lil pieces of custardy deliciousness! My Boba Milk Tea definitely filled my addiction for today and I know I will definitely be returning for some more Deli Manjoos! 

PS. They also have a stamp card....free boba drinks!

Taro with coconut?! Yes!

The boba smoothies here are very tasty! My mom had the peanut butter, and my son the cookies and creme. They were both most satisfied with their choices. Prices are definitely comparable to other places, and the taste is a a little better.

It's in the La Bonita shopping center, across from Pepe's Tacos. The major gripe was that it was pretty warm in there, they did have a fan going, but that didn't help much. Other than that, they have a huge selection, horchata! Macha pineapple!? Those will be my next choices!

The customer service here is great, and they have indoor/outdoor seating. 

Yay!

I'm happy I found this place.  I was in the area and decided to try boba city!  I was instantly greeted as I walked in.  There was no customers in there, although they do have seating and a television with the news on.  I had questions about the menu and I got them answered quickly and accurately!  

I say accurately because I wanted to have Thai iced tea but I wanted to get a Thai tea smoothie.  However, at other boba cafes my Thai tea smoothie would always come out icy towards the end of the drink which stinks!! The lady that rang me up reassured me their's wouldn't be like that at all.  She was right!!! Best Thai tea smoothie with boba I've had in Las Vegas!!! It wasn't too sweet either which was great, it had a perfect consistency of a smoothie.  I paid $4.81 with tax for a large.

I encourage people on this side of town to try this place out, it's in the same plaza as Pepe's Tacos and the Supermarket.  It can get crowded, but parking isn't that bad.  I can't wait to get Boba City Cafe's Thai tea boba smoothie again and try other things on their big menu!

I didn't realize this is the same place that moved from Meadows Mall!

The place has few tables, they serve rice plates, gelato, shakes, coffee, and of course BOBA!! :D I didn't catch the name of the man who greeted us he was very friendly and was generous when sampling gelato! He gave us a tip that Deli Manjoo is served fresh everyday at 2pm and it sells out quick. I first knew them from Meadows Mall and I loved their taro boba. I tried their cookies galore gelato and it's delicious! Now knowing that there's rice plates I look forward to trying the rest of the menu :)

Walked in and the place was empty,  but was greeted quickly.  Menu board is very colorful with plenty of items listed.

Ordered the grilled pork sandwich ($5.75), which was the only sandwich they sell here and was pleasantly surprised.   It is not your classic thit nuong banh mi,  but a fusion with a thicker saut√© pork meat that was cut in one inch square. The best part was the baguette which looks to be toasted using an oven that made the bread extra crunchy with a light crisp texture and not tough at all. The daikons,  pickles,  cilantros,  and carrots weren't cut length wise (oh well) and they had a special sauce that had a dull orange color. Kind of like thousand islands color. 

Honey dew slush (3.65) my son wanted it and it tasted like all the slush I get everywhere else.  It was ok. 

Spam musubi (3 piece for 5.75) ok,  this surprised me.  When I placed the order I asked are these pretty big like around town.   She said it is medium size,  but when I got them these were pretty big.   If I were to compare them to an object I would say a little bigger than a bar of soap.   Now image three.  Whoa!
It had that orange sauce in there as well.  I guess they like the fusion trend, but it didn't taste bad at all. 

BTW,  if you check in you get these two little mini puff and they tasted pretty good as well.

Eh.. I was expecting more.
The drink was just eh. Not too flavorful.. Liked the fact that their drinks weren't too sweet. 
Prices are a bit higher than most boba stores in the city. 
I thought it was odd that the employee added boba in my drink when I didn't ask for it. Most places will ask if you'd like boba first. The boba was really soft and mushy..
Still, good customer service. I got some samples of their smoothies while waiting for my drinks and he patiently helped me through the process of choosing what to get.
2 stars for the drinks. One for customer service. Unfortunately not a fan.

I've only ever been to this place one other time and I found the boba to be just alright but I've decided to give them another try! Much to my surprise, they have Horchata w/boba! I've been wanting try this for sometime now. I was pretty skeptical since I've only had Horchata from Mexican restaurants but let me tell you, this was the best Horchata I've ever had!!! So flavorful!! With or without boba. I will be coming back to try more flavors they have to offer! Great job Boba City, you've made me a fan. :)

I absolutely love this place ! Im not a fan of boba balls anywhere so i never order with boba but the smoothies are amazing ! Customer service is spot on ! My husband and i go there so often now to the point that the owners know our order right off the bat ! Regardless if where regulars or not from day one its been all smiles ! Thats what keeps us coming back . I always order the honeydew smoothie and its just the right amount of sweet !!  Ive also had the musubi they make and they put this teriyaki sauce with spicy mayo and its bomb.com !! All in all 5 stars for flavor and customer service !!

I haven't tried everything, but I can say I got fast service for some of the BEST Thai Milk Tea with boba in town - and I get boba A LOT, probably an unhealthy amount.  Perfect amount of sweetness and just plain delicious.  If you love boba as much as I do, check this place out!!

I'm not giving a 5-star just because I have yet to taste any of their boba drinks. But I did try their Deli Manjoo that were so addicting and delicious! The owners had brought over a few samples for our work near by to try and we have been hooked! 

Just today, I went by to get the Deli Manjoos but their machine was broken (BUT THEY ARE IN PROCESS OF FIXING IT ASAP!!!!!!) so I got myself a combination chicken and lamb baguette sandwich and it was so delicious!!!!!!!!  

The (new) owners were such sweethearts and so kind! They are always so welcoming and always smiling :) I will definitely go back, even if I'm not working or just near by!

I'm a fan!  Unlike other places that use flavored powders Boba City actually blends REAL fruit into their smoothies, I ordered my usual honeydew.  Not only were there tapioca pearls but actual honeydew pieces in the same shape as the pearls.  My only complaint would be that cold temperature of the drinks chill the tapioca boba pearls and harden them if you don't drink it fast enough.

Another successful Yelp find. My cousin and I were uber-thirsty from watching Inception (great film) and eating a bucket of sodium with some popcorn in it. This place is in a seemingly run down shopping area, but that made it easy to spot.

I ordered a passion fruit boba while my cousin had a jasmine milk tea boba. Mine was very sweet. I should probably stop ordering passion fruit. I had the same reaction at No 1 Boba. I love passion fruit, but I've started to prefer less sweetness in my drinks.

Anyway, I wasn't blown away by the drinks. They are certainly good and highly refreshing. What makes me lean toward 4 stars is the service. The people there are friendly and kept giving us samples of their other flavors. I think that will prove to work in their favor. I'd like to return and get some of that tarot snow!

Just coming back for the first time in about 6 months maybe and the place looks much nicer than it did before. Color theme and ambiance is much nicer and feels more relaxing menus looks about the same with small snacks, teas, slushies, smoothies, and coffee. 
We got an avocado smoothie with boba, a Taro smoothie with lychee jelly and boba and an order of chicken wings. 
The avocado smoothie was more on the authentic side rich and creamy slightly sweet but it's my gfs favorite place to get this smoothie still. My Taro smoothie wasn't as thick tasting but was sweet and rich. The boba was squishy and chewy and consistent throughout. Wings took probably about twice as long as the boba to come out, maybe 7 minutes.  No big deal there just means they are made fresh so don't order them in a rush and call ahead if you come by on lunch break. The wings were 5 fried drumettes with a dry seasoning on it that I could only describe as tasting very "Asian" like fried food at an Asian market. I loved them they were crispy and had a very unique taste to them that I've never really had before not enough to fill me up but if you're looking for a small tasty snack it's perfect. 
All in all store looks much better than it did before and everything tastes fresh and delicious. We will definitely be back.

Boba City Cafe makes my list as the best boba drinks in Vegas. 

The first sip of my red bean vanilla boba drink, I was like woah. You can actually taste the flavors of the freshness of the red bean. Unlike other boba places, this place has many other ice cream flavors that can be added to your drink to enhance the taste. The boba has a nice chewy texture and even some flavor to it as well.

For those looking for fruits, I saw some fruits in the fridge so it looks like this place actually uses real fruits in their drink, instead of powder.

The drinks came out to $4 for a large, $3 for regular and 50 cents for boba. It can get pricey once we you add ice cream to it, but sometimes you just have to live a little. This is a lot cheaper than Tea Station and on par with all the other places in town.

A boba place with service, that is unheard of! It looks like the boss's wife was working there today. When you're working at you're own business, you tend to work harder a put a little more effort and passion into making your drink, than say the ones at Quickly or Volcano Tea. She offered me a free mango sample, it was delicious. She also gave me a coupon sheet that have some good stuff on there. Lastly, I got a stamp card for a free drink when I buy 10 drinks. Damn them for doing good job of luring me back into this place!

Good ingredients, service, and prices. What more can you ask for?

Boba Tea establishments are very hit-and-miss. It's good to finally find one that has been consistent with the service, taste, and most importantly, texture of the boba(tapioca pearls). It's easy for them to be overcooked = hard, or tempting to be left out long = soggy. 

You can easily tell after two drinks whether or not this place is worth your business.

This is my new regular boba spot as long as I live here.

Stopped by Boba City Cafe for the first time this week and the place was not crowded, but it's probably because it was cold that night and not a weekend. Ordered coffee milk tea, avocado smoothie, and mango ice cream.

The coffee milk tea and mango ice cream were delicious. Very nice flavorful and not too sweet. The avocado smoothie wasn't as good. Not sure if the avocado wasn't ripe or there wasn't enough avocado in the drink, but there were not much flavor.

Customer service was great. I think this place is run by husband and wife. They were super nice and friendly. I'll come back and try their avocado smoothie again just so I can give a fair assessment.

Will definitely order the coffee milk tea (with boba) and mango ice cream again.

I went into this cafe and was greeted by a very pretty young Vietnamese girl. She was the only working there so I think she was the owner possibly. I ordered Vietnamese coffee with Boba and it tasted great. We had a short conversation and I told her I had just moved here from New Jersey a few weeks ago. She was very nice and friendly and I look forward to going back for more coffee again.

I was in the Spring Valley area the other day & I was craving Milk Thai Tea so I decided to check this place out. Can I say yummy yummy yummy! The girl who took my order, also made my drink & it was dam good. I've had alot of Milk Teas from a variety of different places. I want to say both their drink & boba were off the charts! This is a cute trendy lil place. Colorful atmosphere, cool retro tables & chairs. Location is really clean. Staff is pleasant & helpful. I wish they were closer to my house I'd go all the time!

This place is on my "never go again" list. I got the wrong order but she just blamed me for incorrectly placing my order...huh?!?  Tea taste was nothing special, i did like that it wasnt overly sweet, but the boba balls were not fresh (not springy and chewy).

They mixed up the sizes of my party and I's drinks, first of all. Secondly, four drinks came out but we had to wait ten minutes for the last drink to come and even the people who order before us had gotten their drinks before we had. The worker was rude to a customer who didn't want her boba shaken, and argued as to why the customer "hadn't told her beforehand" before rudely taking it back. I don't know if i would come back, maybe if I really wanted boba. Boba was a little much since it's not that good.

Okay, I have to update my review again.  Sadly, this involves taking away a star.  Sigh.  I don't wanna do it, because I really love and respect what this place is doing.  I love their fresh ingredients, and their food has a lot of love put into it... but...

The boba is pretty yucky sometimes.  Mushy and just not flavorful.  When I tried it the first time, I was still new to this whole boba thing.  Now that I've experienced the wonderfully delicious boba at places like Tea Station and Easy Life, I can't pretend this is good.  It isn't.  Sigh.

But I'm still a fan.  I will just get my drinks sans boba :)

New owners and thank god! They've turned Boba City into a solid boba place.

I'm Asian. I order boba 1-3 times a week. Oddly enough, I don't have much of a sweet tooth. I do, however, LOVE that they're so flexible with the sugar content at Boba City and they do so without ruining the taste of the drink! It helps that they use real fruit in their smoothies as well (strawberry, mango, etc.) It really makes the difference. I'm more of a matcha green tea smoothie or green milk tea person myself, but they are indeed tasty. The owner made me a Peach Iced Green Tea w/ Boba one time which is also worth a try! And again, saved me the sugar rush. :) 

I guess half the battle is finding someplace that cooks their boba correctly and consistently. It was almost depressing to visit my "used to be go-to" Perfect Scoop and discover that their drinks and their boba went to h***. MUSHY is never a good thing. Boba City always has the perfect texture--that firm but soft feel that everyone's after. You can tell it's fresh and sweetened to perfection. They use a blend of brown & white sugar + honey. The perfect cocktail for boba perfection!

Their food isn't' half bad either. I'm a sucker for a good Viet sandwich (banh mi). While the bread they use here is a tad bit unorthodox, the ingredients are A+. The meats are delicious. When I found out the owner's mom uses a family recipe to marinate the pork used in the sandwiches I just about died... and then asked for the recipe. I didn't get it :(

Anyway, Boba City is under new management and it's finally under control. Solid 4.5 stars.
I came in today and I was greeted with a smile by the employee. She was very kind and the smoothie I ordered was made to perfection! This place has definitely earned my business!!

place is good from what i remember

the goods
Toffee mocha: sweet, and rich, i had to drink water after i was done with this thing
Kbbq beef: good, its meat, and sweet, but its a good snack 
Mango ice tea: i think this was super sweet too, but i think it also tasted like they grinded up a mango and purified it and made it a tea, tasted like a liquid mango!

the restaurant:
nice small place, clean

the service:
these guysa re quick! they get you in and out!

Very good fresh fruit smoothies, taro snow bubble, etc if thats what you are looking for.  Teas is at least decent, only tried one so I don't know how good it really is, and the boba balls themselves were a little mushier than I like, so one star off for that.  Otherwise, big thumbs up, especially for fresh fruit smoothies.

No wonder about all the changes, just seeing on here that they changed owners and it isn't for the better. I just went here last week after not having come for probably about a year (I frequent Easy Life) after having a craving for a plain iced green tea with boba. There were a couple ladies that made it in before me and they proceeded to take forever to order, and then the guy (he was working alone) started on their drinks. It took 10 minutes of standing there just to be able to put my order in. So then I order my "large plain iced green tea with boba" and it took another 15 to receive it between the cashier making the order ahead of me and finishing my order as well as the order of the guy behind me at the same time. I didn't even think it was my drink since it was a slush and not iced tea. Confused, I picked it up and high tailed it out of there not wanting to waste another minute since my quick boba stop took nearly 30 minutes. There was a group of guys waiting behind us that had been standing there for at least 10 minutes and had yet to put their orders in.

That gentleman working on a slow Monday afternoon was not the slowest person in the world but he could definitely pick up the pace considering how unbusy it was and how long it took for us to get our drinks. I tasted it after getting in the car and it wasn't horrible but definitely too sweet and a huge letdown for the amazingly delicious and refreshing iced green tea that used to be served here. I'm guessing that it is not offered anymore since I ordered it the way I always used to yet at the same time did not find anything on the menu indicating that they offered non-flavored green tea. My bad...?? What kind of boba place offers every flavor of iced green tea but not plain??? The boba was ok, I just couldn't get past the crappy drink that I only had half of. Between the way too sweet drink and beyond slow service I will frequent my other regulars and also try some ones new to me.

Second verse, and the boba were worse. I finally gave Boba City a second shot. I have my standard boba order: Green tea, no sweet, boba! Sadly, the boba were still a disappointment. They had little flavor and were very mushy. After two tries and two below average tapioca tastings, I am left to think that they don't run tight quality control on what can be pearls of deliciousness. I will be sticking to boba drinks elsewhere.

I only tried a mango green tea with boba, so I can't say I'm ready to bestow 5 stars until I've tried some other things. That being said, my tea was very well executed and the boba were perfect. The store is clean and cute and the guy working there (the owner?) was incredibly friendly and personable. I will be back to try more boba drinks!! If you're in the area - don't drive to chinatown, give this spot a try instead. They also serve some tasty looking food, another plus !

I had a Lychee green tea with boba and strawberry gelato on a waffle cone for almost 8 on a wednesday night. 

- Service was pushy. The lady who helped us, kept asking if we we're ready yet. At least give a recommendation on what's popular rather than saying "do you know what you want now?"
- Boba was disgusting. I actually tried my best to avoid eating the boba. it was mushy, old, and not bubbly at all. Coming from the OC where boba is on point, this was just too mediocre. 
- The Lychee green tea tasted alright. I was expecting actual lychee bits. Is that too much to ask for? haha
- Gelato was good. I'm no gelato expert, but I can't complain about flavor. All I can say is the picture on yelp is a bit deceiving. 
- I think they have a picture of a strawberry shortcake from COLD STONE?? LOL

Las Vegas Boba is a huge fail. Just stick with the popular chains like Tea station here. LOL.

-____-

Nice little local spot for boba in the Spring Valley area. Boba City Cafe is a good place for a daytime snack or for those small get-togethers with a friend or two. It's really convenient because it's right around the corner from where I live. 

I came in to get a quick snack before running errands and had the honeydew fruit slushie with boba and their order of chicken wings.

Usually when I go to boba places that offer slushies, they're not blended well and I end up having to chew on little pieces of ice. Boba City Cafe's slushie was blended well and had no bits of ice, just the full flavor of the honeydew. The boba was close to perfect with it being not too gooey in texture, but not rock hard either. It was more on the softer side, which I prefer. The chicken wings were pretty bomb. They were golden-brown in color and had this seasoning on it that had a little spicy kick.

Seating is limited (each table had two chairs each) and they didn't seem to have a "small" size (the smallest size is their medium). 

Great place to pick up a little snack and drink if you don't want to venture into Chinatown for boba.
Mediocre taste and horrible service. Always one person working and takes forever to make the boba.

I don't usually buy smoothies or anything else of that kind, and I don't know much about it, but I got some passion fruit drink with strawberry boba, I think lol but it was the best drink I ever tried! Exactly what I like, not too sweet, refreshing and tasty. Jen, the owner, was very polite and friendly and helped me to choose what I could like. Will definitely come back here, and will bring my friends!

Just came back from here...  I ordered a large milk tea ($3.99, a regular is $2.99), but I didn't opt for the 50 cents boba for some reason.  It was dead I went on this Friday afternoon, and I don't see how it could evera be busy since everything in this Rainbow and Flamingo block is closed down (the Albertson's next door has been closed for over a year if I remember correctly).  
Anyway, the milk tea is good...  they also had other flavored milk teas, smoothies, and ice cream.  They also baked some peanut shaped pastry thing, but they didn't have any at that moment.  I'll probably go back if I'm ever in the area if I don't feel like driving to Chinatown for boba.

I don't think I can express just how much I love this place.
The slushes are delicious, and the boba pearls are a perfect consistency.  They have a good selection of appetizers, and sandwiches.  The food is pretty cheap. Only 2.99 for 3 amazing pork egg rolls. There are also some interesting gelato, and ice cream flavors like spiced chai, and taro.  
The service is excellent.  The lady that worked there surprised us with some samples of banana strawberry slush (sooo good!).  I can't wait to go back and try everything.

Even though there is new management the quality is still great I miss the old owners but the new ones are doing a great job there self. Thank you!!!! Oh yea and the prices have went up can't argue with that. Still holding on strong love you guys.
I go to this place almost all the time . They are never out of anything . I love there chai tea it my favorite when I go I usually bring my friend and she gets the honey dew slush with boba
I have got to say, every time I come here I pray to Nam, for being such a great, humble demigod. 5 stars.

The atmosphere was pretty decent. When me and friends walked in, the place was empty. There selection on boba isn't really out of the norm. Personally for me I like to have different kinds of boba flavors. I ordered a milk tea with boba but my cup had a hole in it. The employee kindly replaced it for me. The prices are a little high than most places I've been too. Also I can say the bathroom was clean, which is a plus.
